to get there to manage costs and get the most benefits I'm going to describe

loftier goals would be these ones can we reduce the reliance on our people so if

these five right visibility system says consistency
err prevention flexibility and helping users so when we talk about visibility
of system status from an API perspective it means I'm evaluating your API how
easy is it for the client developer or the client machine to understand what has happened it's sent a request in how
much information are you providing back in terms of status progress conditions
state internal state right how much information are you surfacing is it the right level of information we should
also evaluate API is based on consistency and standards consistency here means when you use words in your
data model and in your interaction model do they mean the same thing everywhere
which turns out to be incredibly important right consistency is like a hallmark of usability when it comes to
api's also are you using your organizational and industry
specifications and standards properly someone needs to be checking that we
should evaluate api's based on how well they do at preventing errors from happening so have we made things too
complicated are people prone to make mistakes because of the design of the interface are there points of coupling that as an
expert you can recognize that you know we'll call it caused breakages in the future we should also be evaluating
api's based on their flexibility what I mean by this is if I'm using your API
for the first time there might be lets say an easy mode there might be endpoints your eyes signatures objects
that make sense to me because I don't know your API that well but one year in do you also support me now that I know
your API very well are there ways to call operations that are optimized what
about things like batching and pagination and all these kinds of accelerators advanced features how many
of those do we have do we have opportunities to put those in where they don't exist today and then finally we have to evaluate
error information does it address both human and machine interface concerns so
for example let's say we have this API what does some kind of long-running job and we see this is a response a trivial

infinitely more valuable from a design perspective is to write this code so not

what I need is a picture right so the idea is to start surfacing that out and
looking at the API from that perspective I'm amazed that we don't do this the

asks me one of these things how reversible is this decision if you make
the wrong decision now are you stuck with it I have to say unfortunately for most of the ways we do api's the answer
is usually not very reversible because of our shared models right shared data
model shared interaction model but if you can find opportunities where you can
